ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would recommend this course to a fellow student. I think the course is an engaging way to learn about social science research methods, especially for students new to social science research.
Yes, this course is helpful especially for students new to grad school. It would be helpful, however, to have some background in sociology first.
- Great overview of major issues in research design. Engaging seminars. Would recommend.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course generally helped me to think more critically about epistemology and methodology. I learned about research methods I hadn't really considered using in my work, as well as gained more knowledge about research methods I was already interested in. In particular, the final project was very useful in spurring me to think more critically about the research method I hope to specialize in.
I feel far more comfortable in developing research questions and projects now than before taking this course.
- Excellent overview of major issues in research design. Good practice in writing a proposal.
